member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum log level severity that will be sent to the Log event.
member.returns: The currently set for logging level.

member.name: P:Discord.DiscordConfig.DisplayInitialLog
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the initial log entry should be printed.
member.remarks: If set to , the library will attempt to print the current version of the library, as well as the API version it uses on startup.

member.name: P:Discord.DiscordConfig.UseSystemClock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not rate-limits should use the system clock.
member.remarks:
If set to , we will use the X-RateLimit-Reset-After header to determine when a rate-limit expires, rather than comparing the X-RateLimit-Reset timestamp to the system time.
This should only be changed to false if the system is known to have a clock that is out of sync. Relying on the Reset-After header will incur network lag.
Regardless of this property, we still rely on the system's wall-clock to determine if a bucket is rate-limited; we do not use any monotonic clock. Your system will still need a stable clock.

member.name: P:Discord.DiscordConfig.UseInteractionSnowflakeDate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the internal expiration check uses the system date + snowflake date to check if an interaction can be responded to.
member.remarks:
If set to then the CreatedAt property in an interaction will be set to when it was received instead of the snowflakes date.
This will still require a stable clock on your system.

member.name: P:Discord.DiscordConfig.ResponseInternalTimeCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not any responses to Discord will make an internal expiration check.
member.remarks: This should generally be set to in a development environment due to potential latency issues.

member.name: P:Discord.DiscordConfig.FormatUsersInBidirectionalUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Rest/Socket user override formats the string in respect to bidirectional unicode.
member.remarks:
By default, the returned value will be "?Discord?#1234", to work with bidirectional usernames.
If set to , this value will be "Discord#1234".

member.name: F:Discord.DiscordConfig.MaxThreadMembersPerBatch
member.summary: Returns the max thread members allowed to be in a request.
member.returns: The maximum number of thread members that can be gotten per-batch.

member.name: F:Discord.DiscordConfig.MaxApplicationDescriptionLength

member.name: F:Discord.DiscordConfig.HeartbeatIntervalFactor
member.summary: Returns the factor to reduce the heartbeat interval.
member.remarks: If a heartbeat takes longer than the interval estimated by Discord, the connection will be closed. This factor is used to reduce the interval and ensure that Discord will get the heartbeat within the estimated interval.

member.name: P:Discord.ForumChannelProperties.ThreadCreationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets rate limit on creating posts in this forum channel.
member.remarks:
Setting this value to anything above zero will require each user to wait X seconds before creating another thread; setting this value to 0 will disable rate limits for this channel.
Users with or will be exempt from rate limits.
member.exception: Thrown if the value does not fall within [0, 21600].

member.name: M:Discord.IChannel.GetUsersAsync(Discord.CacheMode,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of users that are able to view the channel or are currently in this channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
This method will attempt to fetch all users that is able to view this channel or is currently in this channel. The library will attempt to split up the requests according to and . In other words, if there are 3000 users, and the constant is 1000, the request will be split into 3 individual requests; thus returning 53individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of users.

member.name: M:Discord.IChannel.GetUserAsync(System.UInt64,Discord.CacheMode,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a user in this channel.
member.param: The snowflake identifier of the user (e.g. 168693960628371456).
The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task result contains a user object that represents the found user; if none is found.

This method sends a file as if you are uploading an attachment directly from your Discord client.

member.name: M:Discord.IMessageChannel.GetMessagesAsync(System.Int32,Discord.CacheMode,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets the last N messages from this message channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
Do not fetch too many messages at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of messages specified under . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 messages, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.

example.para: The following example downloads 300 messages and gets messages that belong to the user 53905483156684800.

member.param: The numbers of message to be gotten from.
The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of messages.

member.name: M:Discord.IMessageChannel.GetMessagesAsync(System.UInt64,Discord.Direction,System.Int32,Discord.CacheMode,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of messages in this channel.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
Do not fetch too many messages at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of messages specified under around the message depending on the . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 messages, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.

example.para: The following example gets 5 message prior to the message identifier 442012544660537354.
The following example attempts to retrieve messageCount number of messages from the beginning of the channel and prints them to the console.

member.param: The ID of the starting message to get the messages from.
The direction of the messages to be gotten from.
The numbers of message to be gotten from.
The that determines whether the object should be fetched from cache.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of messages.

Setting this value to anything above zero will require each user to wait X seconds before sending another message; setting this value to 0 will disable slow-mode for this channel.
Users with or will be exempt from slow-mode.
member.exception: Thrown if the value does not fall within [0, 21600].

member.exception: Thrown if the value does not fall within [0, 21600].

member.name: P:Discord.GuildProperties.SystemChannelFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the flags that DISABLE types of system channel messages.
member.remarks: These flags are inverted. Setting a flag will disable that system channel message from being sent. A value of will allow all system channel message types to be sent, given that the has also been set. A value of will deny guild boost messages from being sent, and allow all other types of messages. Refer to the extension methods , , , and to check if these system channel message types are enabled, without the need to manipulate the logic of the flag.

remarks.note: The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
Do not fetch too many bans at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!

member.param: The amount of bans to get from the guild.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A paged collection of bans.

member.name: M:Discord.IGuildScheduledEvent.GetUsersAsync(Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of N users interested in the event.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual messages as a collection.
This method will attempt to fetch all users that are interested in the event. The library will attempt to split up the requests according to and . In other words, if there are 300 users, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 3 individual requests; thus returning 3 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of users.

member.name: M:Discord.IGuildScheduledEvent.GetUsersAsync(System.UInt64,Discord.Direction,System.Int32,Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Gets a collection of N users interested in the event.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the individual users as a collection.
Do not fetch too many users at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of users specified under around the user depending on the . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 users, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.
member.param: The ID of the starting user to get the users from.
The direction of the users to be gotten from.
The numbers of users to be gotten from.
The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: Paged collection of users.

member.name: T:Discord.InteractionResponseType
member.summary: The response type for an .
member.remarks: After receiving an interaction, you must respond to acknowledge it. You can choose to respond with a message immediately using or you can choose to send a deferred response with . If choosing a deferred response, the user will see a loading state for the interaction, and you'll have up to 15 minutes to edit the original deferred response using Edit Original Interaction Response. You can read more about Response types Here.

member.name: M:Discord.IMessage.GetReactionUsersAsync(Discord.IEmote,System.Int32,Discord.RequestOptions,Discord.ReactionType)
member.summary: Gets all users that reacted to a message with a given emote.
member.remarks:
The returned collection is an asynchronous enumerable object; one must call to access the users as a collection.
Do not fetch too many users at once! This may cause unwanted preemptive rate limit or even actual rate limit, causing your bot to freeze!
This method will attempt to fetch the number of reactions specified under . The library will attempt to split up the requests according to your and . In other words, should the user request 500 reactions, and the constant is 100, the request will be split into 5 individual requests; thus returning 5 individual asynchronous responses, hence the need of flattening.

example.para: The following example gets the users that have reacted with the emoji 💕 to the message.
example.code: var emoji = new Emoji("\U0001f495"); var reactedUsers = await message.GetReactionUsersAsync(emoji, 100).FlattenAsync();

member.param: The emoji that represents the reaction that you wish to get.
The number of users to request.
The options to be used when sending the request.
The type of the reaction you wish to get users for.
member.returns: Paged collection of users.

member.name: M:Discord.IUser.CreateDMChannelAsync(Discord.RequestOptions)
member.summary: Creates the direct message channel of this user.
member.remarks:
This method is used to obtain or create a channel used to send a direct message.
In event that the current user cannot send a message to the target user, a channel can and will still be created by Discord. However, attempting to send a message will yield a with a 403 as its . There are currently no official workarounds by Discord.

example.para: The following example attempts to send a direct message to the target user and logs the incident should it fail.

member.param: The options to be used when sending the request.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation for getting or creating a DM channel. The task result contains the DM channel associated with this user.

member.name: M:Discord.UserExtensions.SendFilesAsync(Discord.IUser,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Discord.FileAttachment},System.String,System.Boolean,Discord.Embed,Discord.RequestOptions,Discord.MessageComponent,Discord.Embed[])
member.summary: Sends a collection of files via DM.
member.remarks:
This method attempts to send an attachments as a direct-message to the user.
Please note that this method will throw an if the user cannot receive DMs due to privacy reasons or if the user has the sender blocked.
You may want to consider catching for 50007 when using this method.
If you wish to upload an image and have it embedded in a embed, you may upload the file and refer to the file with "attachment://filename.ext" in the . See the example section for its usage.
member.param: The user to send the DM to.
A collection of attachments to upload.
The message to be sent.
Whether the message should be read aloud by Discord or not.
The to be sent.
The options to be used when sending the request.
The message component to be included with this message. Used for interactions.
A array of s to send with this response. Max 10.
member.returns: A task that represents an asynchronous send operation for delivering the message. The task result contains the sent message.

This method will retrieve all private channels (including direct-message, group channel and such) that are currently opened in this session.
This method will not return previously opened private channels outside of the current session! If you have just started the client, this may return an empty collection.

member.summary: Represents options that should be used when sending a request.

member.summary: Creates a new class with its default settings.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time to wait for this request to complete.
member.remarks: Gets or set the max time, in milliseconds, to wait for this request to complete. If , a request will not time out. If a rate limit has been triggered for this request's bucket and will not be unpaused in time, this request will fail immediately.
member.returns: A in milliseconds for when the request times out.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.CancelToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the cancellation token for this request.
member.returns: A for this request.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.RetryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the retry behavior when the request fails.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.AuditLogReason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason for this action in the guild's audit log.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the reason that will be written to the guild's audit log if applicable. This may not apply to all actions.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.UseSystemClock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this request should use the system clock for rate-limiting. Defaults to .
member.remarks: This property can also be set in . On a per-request basis, the system clock should only be disabled when millisecond precision is especially important, and the hosting system is known to have a desynced clock.

member.name: P:Discord.RequestOptions.RatelimitCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback to execute regarding ratelimits for this request.

member.summary: If a request fails, an exception is thrown immediately.

member.summary: Retry if a request timed out.

member.summary: Retry if a request failed due to a rate-limit.

member.name: F:Discord.RetryMode.Retry502
member.summary: Retry if a request failed due to an HTTP error 502.

member.name: F:Discord.RetryMode.AlwaysRetry
member.summary: Continuously retry a request until it times out, its cancel token is triggered, or the server responds with a non-502 error.

member.name: T:Discord.TokenUtils
member.summary: Provides a series of helper methods for handling Discord login tokens.

member.name: F:Discord.TokenUtils.MinBotTokenLength
member.summary: The minimum length of a Bot token.
member.remarks: This value was determined by comparing against the examples in the Discord documentation, and pre-existing tokens.

member.name: M:Discord.TokenUtils.PadBase64String(System.String)
member.summary: Pads a base64-encoded string with 0, 1, or 2 '=' characters, if the string is not a valid multiple of 4. Does not ensure that the provided string contains only valid base64 characters. Strings that already contain padding will not have any more padding applied.
member.remarks: A string that would require 3 padding characters is considered to be already corrupt. Some older bot tokens may require padding, as the format provided by Discord does not include this padding in the token.
member.param: The base64 encoded string to pad with characters.
member.returns: A string containing the base64 padding.
member.exception: Thrown if would require an invalid number of padding characters.
Thrown if is null, empty, or whitespace.

member.name: M:Discord.TokenUtils.DecodeBase64UserId(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a base 64 encoded string into a ulong value.
member.param: A base 64 encoded string containing a User Id.
member.returns: A ulong containing the decoded value of the string, or null if the value was invalid.

member.name: M:Discord.TokenUtils.CheckBotTokenValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Checks the validity of a bot token by attempting to decode a ulong userid from the bot token.
member.param: The bot token to validate.
member.returns: True if the bot token was valid, false if it was not.

member.name: F:Discord.TokenUtils.IllegalTokenCharacters
member.summary: The set of all characters that are not allowed inside of a token.

member.name: M:Discord.TokenUtils.CheckContainsIllegalCharacters(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given token contains a whitespace or newline character that would fail to log in.
member.param: The token to validate.
member.returns: True if the token contains a whitespace or newline character.

member.name: M:Discord.TokenUtils.ValidateToken(Discord.TokenType,System.String)
member.summary: Checks the validity of the supplied token of a specific type.
member.param: The type of token to validate.
The token value to validate.
member.exception: Thrown when the supplied token string is , empty, or contains only whitespace.
Thrown when the supplied or token value is invalid.
